ca.utoronto.msrg.padres.common.util
Class CommandLine

java.lang.Object
  ca.utoronto.msrg.padres.common.util.CommandLine

public class CommandLine
extends Object

This core class is responsible for processing the command line and storing the list of options and parameters specified. The difference between an option and a command line is that an option does not accept any argument (set to true if it is specified and false otherwise), while a parameter always has an associated value.

Author:
Bala Maniymaran Created: 2011-02-07

Constructor Detail

CommandLine

public CommandLine(String[] optionSpecs)
Construct an instance of this class with that accepts the specified list of options and switches. Once this class is initialized, the command line arguments can be processed using processCommandLine(String[])

Parameters:
optionSpecs - command line argument
See Also:
#initOptions(String[])}

CommandLine

public CommandLine()
Default constructor which simply initialised the class.

See Also:
#CommandLineNew(String[])}
Method Detail

initOptions

public void initOptions(String[] optionKeys)
Initialize allowed options and switches in the class.

Parameters:
optionKeys - Allowed options and switches. Note:
  • Both options and switches can be multi-character.
  • Neither option nor option are specified here with the "-" character (which is necessary at the command line.)
  • Options are marked with a trailing ":" character.
  • Note that this class does not understand mandatory options/switches.

reset

public void reset()

isSpecified

public boolean isSpecified(String name)
Check if the following option or command has been specified. It can be called only after the processCommandLine(String[]) method has been called to process a command line.

Parameters:
name - name of option or command
Returns:
boolean true if it has been specified

isSwitch

public boolean isSwitch(String name)
Check if the following option has been specified. It can be called only after the processCommandLine(String[]) method has been called to process a command line.

Parameters:
name - name of the option
Returns:
boolean true if it has been specified

isOption

public boolean isOption(String name)
Check if the following parameter has been specified. It can be called only after the processCommandLine(String[]) method has been called to process a command line.

Parameters:
name - name of the parameter
Returns:
boolean true if it has been specified

getOptionValue

public String getOptionValue(String name)
Return the value of an option. It can be called only after the processCommandLine(String[]) method has been called to process a command line.

Parameters:
name - name of an option
Returns:
String value of parameter if it is a valid option and specified in the processed command line or null if it is not a valid option name or has not specified in the processed command line.

getOptionValue

public String getOptionValue(String name,
                             String defaultValue)

getParameters

public List<String> getParameters()
Returns the list of parameters (values that are not associated with any option) that are specified in a processed command line. It is better be called after the processCommandLine(String[]) method has been called to process a command line.

Returns:
List of String, which are the parameters found in the command line.

add

public boolean add(String name,
                   String value)
            throws Exception
Adds an option, switch, or parameter to the CommandLine data structure. Either name or value can be null, but not both at the same time.

Parameters:
name - Name of an option or switch. It must not precede with the "-" character. It must be null, if it is a parameter that is being added.
value - The value of an option or parameter. It must be null, if name is a switch.
Returns:
boolean true if the given option/switch/parameter is successfully added
Throws:
Exception

processCommandLine

public boolean processCommandLine(String[] args)
                           throws Exception
This method processes the command line and extracts the list of options and command lines. It doesn't interpret the meaning of the entities, which is left to the application.

Parameters:
args - command line as a collection of tokens
Returns:
true if the command line arguments are successfully processed, false otherwise
Throws:
Exception

public String toString()
